title: Inflation and Stock-Market Volatility Prompts Most Retirees to Alter Finances, Study Finds
sub_head: Higher prices are eating away at the purchasing power of retirement savings
body:
Maddy Dychtwald is an author and co-founder of Age Wave, a think tank and consultancy
Twenty-nine years. Thatâ€™s the ideal length of retirement, according to retirees surveyed in a new study. But many of those retirees are now concerned that inflation and market volatility is impacting their ability to achieve that timeline.
